attributes.action: Blue Badge support for injuries causing short term paralysis and disabilities.
attributes.background: Following an injury or during recovery from surgery you may have limited mobility and so need some of the help a Blue Badge offers like access to disabled parking.  Currently anyone anyone with "temporary" conditions like this do not qualify.  A short term badge should be introduced.
attributes.additional_details: Follow an accident my leg was badly broken. The doctors were able to save my leg but I now have a frame holding it together.  I was rejected for a blue badge as i was told I could walk 100 meters on crutches. I had to appeal explaining that the frame was no guarantee I would recover and without it I would not be able to walk at all plus it's very painful. While in this condition I need access to disabled parking so I can open the car door fully when getting in and out.

attributes.action: Green badge for parent parking
attributes.background: Just like the blue badge for disabled parking. I am proposing a green badge for parent parking. This badge to be given with the bounty pack on the birth of you child with a 5 year expiry date. This is to ensure parent parking spaces are used for parents. Thank you for your help and support
attributes.additional_details:
We all see posts on Facebook of parents becoming upset over non parents parking in parent spaces. 
A simple badge system to ensure these spaces are used for those who really need them. 
These spaces do not need to be near the door of the shop it's the space that is needed. 
The green badge approach will ensure these spaces are used the way the should be.

attributes.action: Debate if Parliament is adequately representing the 48% and moderate Leavers
attributes.background: Remainers accept the Referendum outcome, but many feel that this government's current hard Brexit policy does not represent the 48% who voted Remain and the moderate Leavers who hoped for a softer Brexit. We want Parliament to debate if the current proceedings truly represent The Will of the People.
attributes.additional_details: We voted to leave the EU but did not vote upon the terms of our exit, which were never debated during the run up to the referendum, only speculated upon. HM Government's current policy seeks to appeal to only a small number of ardent Leavers and does not represent the more moderate desires of Remainers, moderate Leavers and "Regrexiteers, who by many estimates now make up the majority of those who voted. We would ask HM Government to debate if the current policy suitably represents their wishes.

attributes.action: Make British colonial history a larger part of the national history curriculum
attributes.background: We propose that the national history curriculum does not currently promote the study of British colonial history, a defining period for Britain and its Commonwealth peers, to a suitable degree of depth. We seek a parliamentary debate on whether the national curriculum should be changed accordingly

attributes.action: Fulfill your promise to 2.5 million tenants, give HA tenants Right to Buy now.
attributes.background: Government have promised to give Housing Association (HA) tenants Right to Buy a year ago. It is only fair HA tenants get equal rights as Council tenants. In my few that promise was the most vote wining promises in the Government manifesto. They owe it to the 2.5 million HA tenants to fulfill it now
attributes.additional_details: Government have promised to give Housing Association (HA) tenants Right to Buy a year ago. It is only fair HA tenants get equal rights as Council tenants. In my few that promise was the most vote wining promises in the Government manifesto. They owe it to the 2.5 million HA tenants to fulfill it now. It is fairness and equality issue to give HA tenants equal rights as Council tenants. FULFILL YOU PROMISE AND PLEDGE TO THE 2.5 MILLION HA TENANTS WHO VOTED FOR YOU. GIVE THEM RTB NOW.

attributes.action: Provide all schools with a cardiac defibrillator machine & staff training
attributes.background: Our local junior school is fundraising £1200 to pay for a cardiac defibrillator machine and staff training as the government doesn't offer funding to schools. In the event of sudden cardiac arrest calling 999 and the use of a defibrillator machine can increase chance of survival from 6-74% !
attributes.additional_details: An excellent cardiac trained nurse has started a fundraising page at our school but what about every school/college and university that doesn't already have one it should be law.

attributes.action: Payments to carers should be increased significantly.
attributes.background: Carers should be paid a decent living wage and not the pittance of £62.50 per week. Carers save the Government, billions of pounds a year. If all carers just gave up then there would not just be a crisis but total meltdown of social care. Carers should be cared for by the Government.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to have carbohydrate content lists
attributes.background:
Diabetic children all over the Uk miss hot school meals as there's no legal requirement for school to have carb  contents for their meals. 
As a diabetic child, Riley (7) has to injection insulin every time he eats, the amount depends on the carbs he is about to eat. Without this info he cannot eat
attributes.additional_details:
As a type1 diabetic you must inject inject insulin with all food and drink for life, there is no cure, there is also no cause so it's unpreventable!
The amount you inject depends on the amount of carbohydrate you are about to eat.
At the minute there is no legal requirement for schools to have this information meaning children are missing out on a hot school meal.
I believe all schools in the uk should have a list of carbohydrate contents for each meal so our children can eat a healthy hot meal

attributes.action: I want  to create a law to neuter domestic pets except for registered breeders.
attributes.background: Hundreds and thousands of pet animals are slaughtered as there are not enough homes. I have volunteered in pet rescue for  years and its now  worse as peoples lifestyle and priorities in 21st century have changed. Cruelty and neglect are commonplace. Reduce the numbers humanely stop them being born.
attributes.additional_details: Rescue centres are being swamped with unwanted pets They are turning away animals that vets are having to destroy just because they are no longer wanted or cannot be afforded  A law that all domestic animals are neutered unless bred by legislated breeders could stop the puppy farms, and cruelty and neglect by ignorance and greed of casual breeding, and these innocent creatures of all ages could have loving homes  Check the websites of animal charities to see the levels of neglect and euthanasia

attributes.action: primary schools to teach kids private parts are private, and don't keep secrets
attributes.background: help prevent child abuse, if children no from a young age that private parts are private an don't keep secret games this can help prevent child abuse no matter how much you trust the person who looks after your child you can never totally be sure, a lot of child abuse is done by a family member.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me an sign this petition an share it, I couldn't help some one who is very close to me but this might be able to help someone else !!

attributes.action: Make Personal Development classes part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sources suggest that on average, children spend just under 800 hours in a classroom each year! During this time a range of subjects will be taught and skills will be gained. However, in the midst of Maths, Science, PE and others, when do you hear kids shouting "I'm off to Personal Development Class"
attributes.additional_details:
I do not have an issue with the standard of education our children get, but I want them to have an opportunity each week to work on Developing themselves, to learn and build on attributes such as Resilience, Self Motivation and Empathy to name a few. 

“A teacher has two jobs: fill young minds with knowledge, yes, but more important, give those minds a compass so that that knowledge doesn't go to waste.” - Mr Hollands Opus 1995 (movie)

attributes.action: Reduce fuel VAT to 5%
attributes.background: As energy VAT is at 5%; fuel such as petrol and diesel should also be reduced to 5% as they are also non-renewable energy sources.

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Make using mobile devices behind the wheel the same punishment as drink driving.
attributes.background: Make using a hand held device behind the wheel of a vehicle the same punishment as drink driving, a 12 months ban.Research shows that using a device behind the wheel lowers driving standards further than 2-3 units of alcohol in your system,but yet alcohol gets you a ban where a phone is just points.

attributes.action: Make Civil Partnerships for Heterosexual Couples legal
attributes.background: Many heterosexual couples do not want to get married but want to prove their commitment to each other and would like their relationship, assets and children to be legally protected.
attributes.additional_details: Marriage has historically been a  religious and patriarchal institution that some couples don't want to be associated with. Unmarried couples with property and children are particularly vulnerable; even if they have wills, and in the case of a partner becoming ill or dying they are not always considered as next of kin. It seems discriminatory that homosexual couples have the choice of marriage and civil partnership but heterosexuals only have marriage.

attributes.action: Stop councils selling off hundreds of our school's playing fields ! #WeSayNO
attributes.background:
Please see TES article link below for shocking details and sign & share this petition #WeSayNo #EnoughIsEnough 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-councils-sell-hundreds-acres-school-playing-field-land

attributes.action: Stop King George Hospital being downgraded to an urgent care centre.
attributes.background: Redbridge could be left without an accident and emergency unit if proposals go ahead – leaving 300,000 out of reach of emergency medical care.
attributes.additional_details: Under the North East London Sustainability and Transformation Plan (STP), the A&E at King George Hospital in Goodmayes, will be downgraded to an urgent care centre, with changes proposed to come into effect by summer 2019. Emergency cases in the borough will instead be taken to Queen's Hospital in Romford, in Havering, or Whipps Cross University Hospital, in Waltham Forest. Whipps Cross was rated as "inadequate" by the Care Quality Commission in December last year. Profit before Patients.

attributes.action: Debate funding for social care and the inequalities it poses to the NHS budget
attributes.background: Iris Sibley is not alone. Yes this is an extreme case and is not the norm, but the notion of being stuck in a hospital bed (at a cost of £90,000-the equivalent to 90 weeks in a home) because social care cannot respond is not excuse for failing our older generation. We need a national discussion.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/feb/06/woman-89-trapped-hospital-six-months-despite-fit-leave-iris-sibley

attributes.action: Provide asylum for LGBTQ+ refugees affected by Trumps travel ban.
attributes.background: Trump's ban on refugees in the US will have a devastating effect on LGBTQ+ people seeking refuge. It will impact LGBTQ+ asylum seekers and refugees already living in the US. We call on the UK government to uphold Britain's outstanding respect for, and protection of, LGBTQ+ people and rights.
attributes.additional_details: Trump's ban on refugees will disproportionately affect LGBTQ+ refugees and asylum seekers. The UK has an enviable cultural and legal stance that protects LGBTQ+ people. Helping people from this community that will face extreme danger would not only uphold our values as a nation, but send a strong message to the Trump administration that we do not accept his persecution of marginalised communities. We ask the UK government to extend a welcome and provide protection to communities seeking asylum.

attributes.action: Create an independent ombudsman for complaints against parcel companies.
attributes.background: Users of companies such as Hermes regularly suffer lost parcels, parcels left out in the open, thrown over walls, in bins, squashed through letterboxes etc. These companies provide totally inadequate compensation, often refusing to accept responsibility, investigate or compensate.
attributes.additional_details:
Some examples of common practise by these companies:
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/2206718/hermes-delivery-driver-pictured-with-so-many-parcels-crammed-into-his-car-that-it-was-impossible-to-see-out-of-the-passenger-window/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/weird-news/9-times-delivery-drivers-drove-customers-to-despair-a6745546.html

A litany of complaints by frustrated users with no avenue to turn to:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/490161297788303/

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: Exempt all properties with a broadband speed <10 Mbps from Council Tax
attributes.background: Broadband is an essential service, but due to local and central government decisions, many millions of people do not have sufficient access.  A lack of good broadband makes property unsaleable, i.e. essentially worthless, and so should not be subject to Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details: Various government initiatives have failed to provide the necessary service to all, indeed they have been specifically excluded from the programmes.  The option to move is not available with low speeds, and this disadvantage should be recompensed through exemption from Council Tax.  The USO is still some years away, by which time further improvements in speed will be required,  Therefore, the 10Mbps rate should double every 2 years in line with Nielsen's Law of Internet Bandwidth.

attributes.action: Ask the Treasury to abolish the proposed company car tax changes.
attributes.background: The Government have pushed the public to buy "clean cars" via grants and tax breaks. Thousands of drivers including myself have followed their advice and incentives to purchase. They are now looking tax us for following their advice - The changes are unjust and a u-turn leaving us out of pocket.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us have made the decision to buy a more expensive hybrid car because UKGOV asked us to by offering financial contributions and tax breaks. My family and I, (like many others) are now facing greater tax bills than I had with my previous diesel vehicle - How is this fair? I feel the public have been miss-sold and miss-guided by UKGOV. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3909606/Company-car-drivers-face-paying-thousands-tax-new-plans-announced-month.html

attributes.action: Abolish the "standard living allowance" under 35!
attributes.background: I am 21 years of age. I was made homeless two weeks ago, I have done everything I possibly could while working part time to get my own place. The government will only pay for me to live in shared accommodation of £210 a month.
attributes.additional_details: I spent long enough explaining to them I am unable to live in shared accommodation due to my mental health issues. I have tried to get a one bed flat and nothing I do for universal credit is good enough. How can the government expect our future generation to live with their parents till 35 because most of us can't get help to live alone! Why are we expected to live like students? Why do they not care for people with mental or physical health disabilities? I now have two options. Live on my friends couch, or move back with my parents which I cannot do. Is this acceptable to keep our younger generation in such horrible circumstances?

attributes.action: Force water suppliers to remove water meters and create a fair banding charge.
attributes.background: Water meters have created a heavy burden on poorer families as bills have risen more than double since their introduction. There are many families who are hundreds of pounds in debt to the water companies and are being chased by debt companies. Water is a human right to have not a luxury.

attributes.action: Compulsory jail sentences for the possession of pornographic images of children
attributes.background: I can imagine everyone with young children in their lives would do anything and everything to protect them, just as I would my young brothers. However, the leniency and attitude criminal courts have began to display towards those who exploit our children for their own sexual thrill has disturbed me.
attributes.additional_details: I am calling for all those, with/without a record or pleads/is found guilty of possessing indecent images, to be sent to jail. Regardless of displayed remorse, paedophiles are becoming more and more of a problem. With the digital age modernising the world at an immense pace, paedophiles will find it easier to anonymise themselves - when, the truth is, they need punishment and rehabilitation.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and distribution of single-use plastic drinks bottles in the UK
attributes.background: Billions of single-use plastic drinks bottles are sold each year in the UK. Too many of these end up on our beaches and in our oceans, where they harm marine and bird life life. This can be avoided by using less damaging alternatives such as aluminium cans, cardboard cartons and glass.

attributes.action: Make it a Criminal Offence to Teach a Fitness Class without a Qualification
attributes.background:
This Law will make sure that Fitness Instructors have knowledge of Anatomy and Physiology before teaching a Fitness or wellbeing class.
It will also help our battle against the obesity rate in the UK.
If not the risk will increase of participants getting injured and less will achieve results.
attributes.additional_details:
Poll i conducted on my Facebook Group Fitness Professionals Association.
Do you think you should have Pre-requisite qualifications like ETM or Level 2 to attend a Les Mills or Zumba initial training course?

Totally agree 110
Don't agree  6
Maybe 1

attributes.action: Create a Fast Track immigration counter for UK BRP Card Holders at UK airports.
attributes.background: UK residents with a valid BRP card / visa should be allowed to use the fast track service at airports to enter the country apart from using the usual immigration counter.

attributes.action: Give more mental health training to professionals - emergency services and A&E
attributes.background: I've had trips to A&E and other incidents with the police where I felt the staff weren't adequately trained and aware of mental health

attributes.action: Make it illegal for rail fares to rise without inflation and improved services
attributes.background: Every year the public has to pay more to travel on a train network that is not contributing back to the paying customers who along with businesses rely on the efficient running of the railway, delays cancellations and strikes are increasing in number and action needs to be taken rapidly.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2012/sep/14/insurance-companies-defraud-us

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/money/insurance/article4632734.ece

http://www.mindfulmoney.co.uk/mindful-news/an-end-to-auto-renewals-insurers-forced-to-provide-premium-comparison/

http://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/10/the-car-insurance-industry-is-a-disgusting-racket/

http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/abs/10.1016/S1529-2096%2806%2907002-7

http://uk.practicallaw.com/2-200-4590?q=&qp=&qo=&qe=

attributes.action: Owners of UK newspapers must be British citizens
attributes.background: Newspapers have enormous influence in UK politics, but the biggest of them are not owned by British citizens. They have power without being real stakeholders in society.  Those seeking to influence UK politics and opinion should actually be citizens who will have to live with the results.

attributes.action: Rethink the way dla assess babies born and affected by talipes (clubfoot)
attributes.background: My son was born in 2011 with talipes( clubfoot in 1 of his feet) it was turned inwards. From 3 days old he had a full leg cast on, every week we went a 102 mile round trip to see his consultant, At 3 months his tendon cut and then he wore ponsetti boots and bar -firstly for 23hrs a day then 12hrs.
attributes.additional_details: He couldnt kick his legs freely, he couldnt roll over in his bed to get comfortable. He was stuck on his back thumping a metal bar with his little blue boots attached. Some people get dla as the assessor see it requires 'more care' than a normal baby, but like myself we didnt.My son did require more care, and as he got older with the boots on it got harder on him and myself. Dla needs to address this and make a serious decision to if all should get it or none.They are born with this abnormality

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action: stop animal cruelty and any type of testing on animals
attributes.background: i think that there are many other ways to test and experiment with different products in a completely cruelty free way, the UK is part of the chain of the biggest animal cruelty users in the world for no apparent reason. Research will show you scientific ways to test out products without animal use.
attributes.additional_details: PETA is a strong animal cruelty free organisation that fight for the animals rights to their own freedom, not including harmful experiments. I also think that people of the public need to be more educated on this controversial topic to understand what actually happens when making their products that they use every single day.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Get builders regulated to prevent them wrecking our homes, finances and lives.
attributes.background: We suffered from bad builders. Every control failed, including Building Control. The builder went into liquidation owing us and HMRC. We are sick of hearing ‘that’s what builders are like’. In many countries they are regulated. Sign the petition to protect others, perhaps yourself in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Google 'Indigo Development Guardian Article' to read a bit of our story. 
Anyone can set up and work as a builder. Building Control, despite the title, does not protect home owners. Once things goes wrong, builders use liquidation to avoid liabilities and continue trading using another company. Good builders should welcome regulation, bad builders should fear it. 

Scrap Building Control and use the money to protect the public by getting builders registered, as in most countries and industries.

attributes.action: Make MP's expenses payable from their political party funds and not the taxpayer
attributes.background:
The people of the UK hear about cuts to public services they rely on but also about the financial slight of hand performed with MP's expenses.
Take this burden off the public purse.
Call it an austerity measure.
attributes.additional_details: Assuming approximately £100,000 of expenses per MP that saves over £60 million per year that could be spent elsewhere for the benefit of the people.

attributes.action: Stop using the term "benefit" when referring to the state pension.
attributes.background: Calling the state pension a "benefit" is offensive. Civil servants and MPs refer to the state pension under this heading but it does not reflect the tax and NI paid, and the years of working required to qualify. Furthermore it demeans pensioners and undermines dignity in old age.

attributes.action: Once the UK is not bound by EU legislation remove the 20% VAT on e-literature
attributes.background:
Ebooks and paid e-literature  (electronic newspaper/magazine subscriptions) carry 20% VAT but paper books, newspapers and magazines are zero rated for VAT. 
In the past we have been told that EU legislation prevents a 0% VAT rate and that e-literature is a 'service'.
attributes.additional_details:
After BREXIT the UK will set VAT rates on this. 

Claiming e-formats are a service but paper is not is ridiculous since both formats require:
an author
an editor
formatting
Only paper requires tree felling, transport, manufacture, printing, storage, eventual disposal. Re-pulped books require de-inking & disposal of toxic waste.

e-formats need little oil, produce little toxic waste & add almost nothing to carbon emissions.

The government should encourage e-formats by removing this bizarre VAT.

attributes.action: Defend a child's right to equality of education for 2year olds
attributes.background:
Petition for equal rights for ALL children's education, regardless of financial background.

A 2year old can now start education in public schools, government funded. But only qualify if the family receives benefits.

Working families are asked to pay for this service.
attributes.additional_details:
How is this fair that children from working class backgrounds are suffering and missing on education because of funding. I simply cannot afford this service because I work. This needs to change. My child is missing out on education because I chose to provide for my family morally.

Petition for equal rights for ALL children regardless of families financial background.

attributes.action: Prevent the UK defence from becoming useless, fulfil the NATO pledge of 2%
attributes.background: To be spending less than 2 per cent of GDP on defence is utterly unacceptable, particularly in this time of immense global uncertainty.
attributes.additional_details: The IISS said Britain’s defence spending had dipped below the NATO benchmark figure, despite the government vowing to meet the target. However has continued its campaign of unnecessary cuts to defence by selling of well-established bases weakening the defence of the nation. This is a great error in judgement as fails generations of hard work in building our defence to be the best it can be in the modern era.

attributes.action: Take more action to reduce activities that contribute to global climate change.
attributes.background: Deployment of mitigation technologies, as well as deployment of non fossil fuel energy sources will be necessary to achieve a stabilization of the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Support renewables, divest from fossil fuels, tackle pollution and stop Fracking.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar4/
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar5-science-basis/index.htm
One Million Climate Jobs: Tackling the Environmental and Economic Crisis http://www.campaigncc.org/climatejobs

attributes.action: Advise Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Charles Bronson.
attributes.background: We would like the government to approach and advise the Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Micheal Peterson AKA Charles Bronson. As I'm sure you know this man has spent 40+ years in prison,although this man may have done wrong in the past this is excessive.
attributes.additional_details: The sentence is excessive for anyone let alone someone who has never murdered anyone, he has spent a good 80% of his sentence in solitary confinement. This man has served more then his fare share of prison time and should be released immediately. There is no question he may not have been an role model prisoner in the past, but just a simple Internet search will reveal that this man is reformed and draws and sells on his artwork for many charities.

attributes.action: Get the uk goverment to give a larger budget for uk road maintenance
attributes.background: Years of underfunding has left uk roads in a severely poor state, leaving them dangerous in areas

attributes.action: Make children and young people in care's funding go up to the age of 21!
attributes.background: People who have been through the care system will understand....The need for support at 18 years old but none being accessible because there is no funding. We need to fight to change this!
